title: How to Recycle an Old Hot Water Bottle

steps.title: Allow the hot water bottle to dry out.
steps.content: Allow the hot water bottle to dry out. This should be done before you attempt to recycle it. Simply hang it upside down over a faucet, dish drying rack or hang it from your clothes line until it dries out.

steps.title: Remove the stopper from the hot water bottle.
steps.content: Remove the stopper from the hot water bottle.

steps.title: Fill the hot water bottle with fabric scraps, cotton wool balls, rags, foam peanuts, etc.
steps.content: Fill the hot water bottle with fabric scraps, cotton wool balls, rags, foam peanuts, etc. Fill as much as you can push through the stopper hole. It can help to use a ruler, stick or similar item to stuff the material inside the bottle.

steps.title: Screw the stopper back into place once you can't fit anything else inside the hot water bottle.
steps.content: Screw the stopper back into place once you can't fit anything else inside the hot water bottle.

steps.title: Keep the bottle with your gardening gear.
steps.content: Keep the bottle with your gardening gear. Use it to lean on whenever you’re gardening. Keep it clean by wiping it down after you use it, and hanging it up to dry. This cushion can be used for other purposes too, such as a car seat bolster cushion, a head pillow for camping or lying in the grass, a rest for the tablet when you're outdoors, etc.

steps.title: Cut the bottle open following the seams.
steps.content: Cut the bottle open following the seams.

steps.title: Cut a square or circle shape from each side of the opened bottle.
steps.content: Cut a square or circle shape from each side of the opened bottle.

steps.title: Glue the pad onto a gardening or other long-term glove.
steps.content: Glue the pad onto a gardening or other long-term glove. Allow to dry.

steps.title: Know how to use the pet hair remover mitt.
steps.content: Know how to use the pet hair remover mitt. To use it, simply put the glove on and wipe over the area where you’d like to collect pet hairs from. The rubber will pick up the hairs and can either be brushed off with your hands or washed off.

steps.title: Attach the hot water bottle to the wall where you’d like to place floral arrangements.
steps.content: Attach the hot water bottle to the wall where you’d like to place floral arrangements. It can be attached in one of the following ways: Use a self adhering hook with a strong adhesive attached to the bottle. Attach two eyelet screws to the edges of the hot water bottle and attach string from hook to hook for hanging it on a wall hook.

steps.title: Place flowers into the hot water bottle vase.
steps.content: Place flowers into the hot water bottle vase. A dried flower bunch or a single long-stemmed flower make ideal flower displays. Try matching the flower colors with the hot water bottle for the most effective display. If you're adding water, be sure there are not leaks on the hot water bottle up to the level where you plan on adding water.

steps.title: Check that the hot water bottle can be filled with air without leaking.
steps.content: Check that the hot water bottle can be filled with air without leaking. If there are leaks, this method won’t work.

steps.title: Pump some additional air into the hot water bottle to make it taut.
steps.content: Pump some additional air into the hot water bottle to make it taut. Screw the lid in place.

steps.title: Place your feet on the hot water bottle when seated.
steps.content: Place your feet on the hot water bottle when seated. You can either simply rest your feet on it, elevate the foot rest slightly, or you can gently pump or roll your feet on or across the bottle for a gentle stretching exercise.

steps.title: Add more air as needed.
steps.content: Add more air as needed. Store flat.

steps.title: Cut the top of the bottle off.
steps.content: Cut the top of the bottle off. You could cut it curved or straight, however you'd prefer.

steps.title: Attach handles to the hot water bottle.
steps.content: Attach handles to the hot water bottle. Glue or staple gun handles on each side of the top of the water bottle. Suitable handle ideas include: Leather or fabric straps Plaited twine or sisal Rubber lengths Braided fabric Old belts Anything else you can find around the house

steps.title: Make the base of the bag.
steps.content: Make the base of the bag. This includes the front, back and sides, however not the top yet. The base of the bag should be wide enough for the bottle to reach over from the bag back to the front, as a ”lid".

steps.title: Place a bag clasp into the portion of the bottle that was once the top.
steps.content: Place a bag clasp into the portion of the bottle that was once the top. Your bag is now finished. In some versions of this bag, old military truck tarp was used as the back and sides of the bag.

steps.title: Find suitable templates for making the bathtub shapes.
steps.content: Find suitable templates for making the bathtub shapes. Look online or in craft books for shapes that your kids will enjoy. They should be a good size for small hands to hold. Turn the designs into cardboard patterns for tracing around.

steps.title: Cut the hot water bottle open to make two flat sides.
steps.content: Cut the hot water bottle open to make two flat sides.

steps.title: Place the cardboard patterns onto each side, drawing around them using a Sharpie or similar marker.
steps.content: Place the cardboard patterns onto each side, drawing around them using a Sharpie or similar marker. Try to use as much of the rubber as possible by keeping the patterns as closely together as possible.

steps.title: Cut out the shapes.
steps.content: Cut out the shapes. Discard the unused edges.

steps.title: Keep the shapes near the bathtub for playtime.
steps.content: Keep the shapes near the bathtub for playtime. They should stick to the edge of a wet bath and float in the water as well. When they are not in use, ensure that they are left to dry out to prevent mildew.

steps.title: Measure the tablet for fit by laying it on top of the hot water bottle to check the bottle is large enough before proceeding.
steps.content: Measure the tablet for fit by laying it on top of the hot water bottle to check the bottle is large enough before proceeding.

steps.title: Cut the top of the hot water bottle off.
steps.content: Cut the top of the hot water bottle off. Cut in a very straight line.

steps.title: Slip the tablet inside the hot water bottle.
steps.content: Slip the tablet inside the hot water bottle. This is just to check that it fits well. Remove it and continue to make the cover.

steps.title: Stick two large press studs at the top at even spacing.
steps.content: Stick two large press studs at the top at even spacing. You will need to use strong glue to do this. These will serve as the closure for the tablet cover.

steps.title: Slip the tablet inside, snap the press studs closed and presto, you have a padded tablet cover for safe transport.
steps.content: Slip the tablet inside, snap the press studs closed and presto, you have a padded tablet cover for safe transport. Smaller hot water bottles could be used to contain eReaders, half size tablets and even cell phones. Use your imagination as to what will benefit from using this cover.

steps.title: Slip your coins in through the bottle opening and screw the stopper in place each time.
steps.content: Slip your coins in through the bottle opening and screw the stopper in place each time.

steps.title: Amass as many coins as will fit in the hot water bottle.
steps.content: Amass as many coins as will fit in the hot water bottle.

steps.title: Use it to hold your money.
steps.content: Use it to hold your money. You can either bring this hot water bottle with you on errands, or just keep it in your car.

steps.title: Fill the hot water bottle with cold water and tip it over indoor plants as needed.
steps.content: Fill the hot water bottle with cold water and tip it over indoor plants as needed.

steps.title: Keep the stopper out at all times.
steps.content: Keep the stopper out at all times. This will prevent mildew growth and allow the bottle to dry out between uses. Either hang it somewhere such as behind a sink or hall door, or keep in a utility cupboard.

steps.title: Attach earring findings to each stopper, threaded through the stopper hole.
steps.content: Attach earring findings to each stopper, threaded through the stopper hole.

steps.title: Wear with amusement.
steps.content: Wear with amusement. Things can be improved greatly by decorating them but they’ll still be a very unusual fashion statement.
